attributes.action: Make racism part of the national primary curriculum.
attributes.additional_details: They say nobody is born a racist but equally nobody is born fully aware of black history and the violence and unspeakable acts committed against black people nor are they born proactive in seeking equality therefore it is our responsibility to educate children at a young age so they become proactive in seeking equality. The only way this can be done appropriately is through a unified approach within the education system.
attributes.background: Including lgbtq+ in the curriculum is a step towards equality however the same needs to be done in regards to race equality.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
